column8: Uncoated Carbide:    (HARD)                  MAX- FEED               MIN- SFPM
column9: Uncoated Carbide:    (HARD)                  MIN- FEED               MAX- SFPM
column10: Uncoated Carbide:    (TOUGH)                  MAX- FEED               MIN- SFPM
column11: Uncoated Carbide:    (TOUGH)                  MIN- FEED               MAX- SFPM

column1: THREE ADJUSTMENT SLIDERS: ONE FOR THE INBETWEEN OF "HARD AND TOUGH"--------ONE FOR FEED RATE-----------ONE FOR SFPM---------- THE USER WILL PICK MATERIAL-----CHOOSE TOOL SUCH AS UNCOATED CARBIDE OR CERAMIC. NEXT THEY WILL USE THE SLIDER TO ADJUST THE HARDNESS/TOUGHNESS OF THAT TOOL.....THEN THEY CAN GO WITH THE FEED AND SFPM OR ADJUST THEM.
1. Add in a HARD <----> TOUGH slider by taking hard value as minimum and tough as maximum and dividing the difference by 100 to get 1 percent steps for a slider between the two.
